page.title: 01WERRINGTON & DISTRICT
page.content: The area is an agricultural one and is extremely pleasant scenically.It is undulating and contains small hamlets and minor roads.Its eastern boundary is the A388 Launceston to Holsworthy road and the River Tamar. The county boundary in the west between Cornwall and Devon runs close to this road.It is an area of dairy farming with holdings between about 50 to 300 acres.The area is pleasantly dotted with plantations of mixed woodland mainly deciduous. Except for farming it has no other important industry. Some farms take paying guests during the summer.There is very little modern building in the area.The most important building is Werrington Mansion, set in its own grounds,of Tudor origin;it has been added to in the Georgian Age.
